host_about:
Bonjour,

Je suis une jeune femme de 32 ans qui habite à Paris et travaille dans le cinéma comme assistante chef opérateur.
J'aime découvrir de nouveaux lieux, villes, pays ou cultures artistiques et culinaires.
J'ai beaucoup voyagé en Europe, mais également en Amérique centrale et du nord, en Asie du Sud Est, en Australie et en Afrique.
J'ai déjà beaucoup utilisé Air Bnb lorsque j'habitais avec mon copain, pour découvrir de nouvelles villes européennes et pour faire découvrir à des voyageurs multiples notre belle capitale qu'est Paris.
je suis souvent amener a mes déplacer pendant quelques mois pour des tournages et recherche régulièrement des appartements dans de nouvelles villes!
J'aime pouvoir suivre les conseils et recommandations des habitants de chaque ville ou je me déplace et faire de nouvelles découvertes à chaque voyages.

You will be close to: -The hip area of Ledru Rollin and rue de Charonne - Bastille -“Bercy village” (Cour St Emilion), the old wine warehouses transformed into a very cute area with cafes, restaurants and a big cinema -The Bois de Vincennes (the largest public park in the city), if you want to have a walk in the wood, eat and drink by the lake or visit the beautiful castle.  -Gare de Lyon, if you have a train to catch to go to the south of France -Bercy (Accord Hotel Arena), if you have planned to attend one of the many concerts scheduled there!
notes: Please note that my cat is normally living in the apartment so people suffering from cat allergy should be aware of it. Obviously my cat wont be there while renting the apartment ☺
transit: 2 metro lines (6 and 8), the tramway line that goes all around Paris, 3 bus lines and the RER A (suburb train).

host_about:
Nous avons eu un coup de cœur lorsque nous avons visité pour la première fois l’appartement où nous vivons à présent (cela fait 2 mois) : un havre de paix au milieu de la ville, quel bonheur ! C’est un régal de pouvoir prendre le petit déjeuner sur le balcon ou,  tout simplement, écouter le chant des oiseaux. Le beau jardin privatif sur lequel donne le logement inspire le calme, apaise. Ici aucune sensation d’étouffement possible : il suffit d’ouvrir la grande baie vitrée ! L’appartement reste à une température agréable toute l’année quel que soit le temps qu’il fait ! C’est de tout cela que nous souhaiterions faire profiter nos futurs hôtes.
Grands amateurs de tourisme urbain, nous avons visité de nombreuses capitales et autres grandes villes d’Europe et du monde entier, et avons toujours accordé une grande importance à la qualité de l’hébergement. Bref, l’appart’ est très cosy, spacieux (pas de perte d’espace), vous vous y sentirez comme chez vous !
Ce dont je ne pourrais pas me passer (pour répondre aux suggestions de AirBnB pour affiner mon profil) : voyager, « changer de décor », mon temps libre (ô combien précieux pour rencontrer des gens, aller au cinéma, lire, faire des expos…)
street: Porte de Clignancourt, Paris, Île-de-France 75018, France

name: Cosy studio in the heart of Paris
summary: Original apartment in Paris center 11th district close to République square, Oberkampf, Père Lachaise, Bastille, Montmartre. Many restaurants, bars, clubs and shops, boulangeries, supermarkets around.  Metro station very close by (50m) on line 3
space: Very high ceiling (3,20m), which is perfect for the main double bed on an integrated mezzanine, optimizing the apartment space, with the sofa bed under it. The overall place is 28 square meters. The kitchen is separated, as well as the bathroom with a very comfortable and enjoyable large Italian shower where you can relax after a long day walking the Parisian pavement. Apartment is located on the ground floor, courtyard side (not on street side). Absolutly quiet. The sofa bed is a bit old, to be handle carefully when you open the bed part from it, but otherwise works its purpose perfectly. You can use the washing machine, following the instructions written on it. No drying function though :) Either use the drying rack or go to the laudromat very close by. If you want to cook you can find all necessary equipments (pans, casseroles, pots,...), hotplates, microwave/grill.

name: Appartement de charme-Tour Eiffel
summary: This charming and very well equipped one bed room apartment is perfect for 2 people. It is ideally located to go sightseeing around Paris : it is well connected to public transports and is 50 meters away from the Eiffel Tower (160 feet)!
space: The apartment is made up of a main room, a kitchen, a bathroom, toilets and a hallway.  The main room holds a Queen size bed, a living area and a dinner table and a large wardrobe. In the bathroom you will find a bath and a sink and sheets and towels are provided.  The kitchen is perfect for a lovely breakfast. It is equipped with : a microwave oven, a coffee machine, a toaster, a kettle, an electric hob, all the dishes and cutlery you may need as well as coffee, tea and condiments.  The flat is on the bottom floor with views of a nice little courtyard and the pedestrian Rue du Gros Caillou. To go through the main gate, you will need a code and a key to get in the staircase. You will find 3 locks on the front door and secured shutters on all windows.  Guests have access to free unlimited WiFi as well as a telephone line with free calls to 100 destinations. You will also be able to watch a bit of French and international TV on 400 channels.
description: This charming and very well equipped one bed room apartment is perfect for 2 people. It is ideally located to go sightseeing around Paris : it is well connected to public transports and is 50 meters away from the Eiffel Tower (160 feet)! The apartment is made up of a main room, a kitchen, a bathroom, toilets and a hallway.  The main room holds a Queen size bed, a living area and a dinner table and a large wardrobe. In the bathroom you will find a bath and a sink and sheets and towels are provided.  The kitchen is perfect for a lovely breakfast. It is equipped with : a microwave oven, a coffee machine, a toaster, a kettle, an electric hob, all the dishes and cutlery you may need as well as coffee, tea and condiments.  The flat is on the bottom floor with views of a nice little courtyard and the pedestrian Rue du Gros Caillou. To go through the main gate, you will need a code and a key to get in the staircase. You will find 3 locks on the front door and secured shutters on all windows.
neighborhood_overview: The area has a very nice feel to it thanks to all the close by shops which makes the atmosphere friendly and inviting. It is known as « the golden triangle » because it is very chic and because of all the wonderful monuments that you will not want to miss out on such as the Eiffel Tower, Invalides, Trocadéro, Arc de Triomphe, Grand Palais, Quai Branly...  The flat is 50 meters away (160 feet) from the Champ de Mars and 200 meters away from the river Seine. At the corner of la rue du Gros Caillou there are a corner shop, a luxurious food store (opened until 10pm), an amazing butcher's, a shop selling fresh-picked fruit and vegetables, lots of different cafés and restaurants. My personal favourites are : the sushi place at the corner and Gusto's  which servers the best pizza in Paris (eat in or take away). For a fancy dinner out, you could go to Chef Constant's restaurant where they serve outstanding food or to La Fontaine du Mars made famous by the Obamas'.  Have a look around in the fa
notes: I am in love with this apartment simply because it is so cosy and right in the centre of Paris. I really hope that you will remember it as one of your best memories of Paris.
transit: The flat is in the centre of Paris which means bus stops and metro stations are at every corner. It will take you less than 20 minutes to go anywhere really. The closest metro station is Ecole Militaire (5 mins away). You can take line 8 there and it will take you to les Invalides, la Madeleine, Opéra, Printemps and les Galeries Lafayette (shopping centres).  Right at the bottom of the Eiffel Tower, the RER C will take you to the Orsay Museum, Saint Michel, Notre Dame and Versailles.  There are a lot of bus stops around. Bus 80 will take you to Montmartre and Bus 92 to the Champs Elysées and Montparnasse. However, my advice is to wander around on foot or by bicycle because that is the best way to find amazing and unexpected quirky places you would have never thought of going to. From the Roissy-Charles de Gaulle airport : take the RATP shuttle and get off at Opéra, then take line 8 towards Balard and get off at Ecole Militaire. The journey should be about an hour long.  From Orly Airpo
access: Les voyageurs ont accès à l'ensemble de l'appartement et de ses équipements, à l'exception d'une petite partie du placard sur lequel on peut lire : "private" !
interaction: I will meet you at the apartment to give you the keys and get them back on the day you leave, for the incoming and outgoing inventory and to answer any questions you may have!
house_rules: The apartment is non smoker. Because the neighborhood is so quiet we will ask you to not cause any major disturbance past 10pm.  Please  sort out the rubbish and use the recycling bins in the court yard.
host_about:
Je m'appelle Anne-Laure, j'ai 27 ans et je suis une jeune maman. Parisienne depuis toujours, j'adore ma ville et surtout le 7ème arrondissement, le quartier le plus convivial et le plus chic de la capitale. Ce que j'aime le plus : partager mon amour pour Paris. Ses meilleurs restos, les bars branchés et historiques, les musées, les boutiques de créateurs mais aussi les lieux insolites dont Paris regorge. J'ai aussi le goût de l'accueil, mettre mes hôtes à l'aise dans un petit nid propre et charmant : c'est une vrai passion... 
A très bientôt !

My name is Anne-Laure, I am 27 years old and mother of a new born baby. I have always lived in Paris and I absolutely love my city and the 7th arrondissement above all. I am known to share my interest for Paris and all its good spots that are worth a look : the best restaurants, bars, museums, designer shops and unique places.
I also enjoy hosting dinner parties and make my guests feel at home. 

I hope to see you very soon !
street: Tour Eiffel - Champ de Mars, Paris, Île-de-France 75007, France

summary: Nice, design and cosy 130m2 apartment with a great view on the Eiffel Tower. Located on the 5th floor with lift, on the left bank of Paris, only two minutes walk from the lovely Champs de Mars, 5 minutes from le Pont de l'Alma and 10 minutes from Champs Elysées. It makes it a perfect location to visit and enjoy Paris. This confortable, modern and design flat will turn your Parisian stay into a real experience
space: We live in this apartment with our 3 kids so you'll enjoy the French way of living. 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a large dining room will welcome your family. The nicely  decorated bedrooms are situated on the courtyard and very quiet. name: Functional studio, cosy & quiet 7th
summary: I'm renting my apartment when my daughter is away. It's a typical small parisian apartment (21m2 / 226fts), which is bright and calm with windows on the courtyard side. Caution: it's at the 4th floor without any lift.
space: The courtyard is cobblestoned and flowered with a parking for bikes. Be careful, it's on the 4th floor with no lift (as in a lot of buildings in Paris, good to stay fit but inaccessible for handicapped people)  There is a caretaker, a door code, and an intercom.  The apartment contains a main room, a tiny kitchen, toilets and separated shower room. There are windows in main room, kitchen and bathroom. - Main room  There is a table for 4. There is a mezzanine bed for 2 with a futon-mattress, accessible from a wooden "shelf-staircase". Under the bed, you can find a comfy sofa for 1. There are shutters on the main room's windows.  - Kitchen  The kitchen is tiny but very functional, with a table for 2 persons that can refold itself. It is well equipped : baking tray, fridge, freezer, toaster, microwave and oven.  You will find all you need to prepare a nice meal, have a drink or open a can ;) - Shower room Just a shower and a sink.  Separated closets.

neighborhood_overview: The location is very convenient : at less than 100 meters of the 1st cheesemonger of Paris (Quatrehomme). There are 3 supermarkets in the street at less than 250 meters. They stay open late and 2 of them stay open on sundays. Le Bon Marché and La Grande Epicerie de Paris are at the end of the street, Saint Placide and Rennes are very close too and are perfect shopping spots !You will be at walking distance from important spots : Montparnasse Tower, Invalides, Rodin museum, Luxembourg Garden... On evenings, the close-by Princesse Street is ideal to have a drink (Quartier Latin). On sundays, I suggest you to have a walk to the Creation Market near Edgar Quinet metro station.
notes: Before my daughter used to manage the rent and had many visitors. Here's a link where you can read their advices:  https://fr.airbnb.com/rooms/(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN).
transit: The apartment is ideally located on "74 rue de Sèvres", near Metro Duroc. From Duroc Tube Station, 2 different Metro lines :  - Line 13 (Montparnasse Trainstation, Varenne (Rodin museum), Champs Elysées, Saint Lazare trainstation, ...)  - Line 10 (Boulogne, Cluny-la Sorbonne, Gare d'Austerlitz)  Numerous Bus lines inervate to most interesting points of the capital :  - Bus 39 (Saint Germain des près, Palais Royal - Louvre's museum, East Trainstation, North Trainstation, ...)  - Bus 92 (Montparnasse Trainstation, Arc de triomphe/champs élysées, ...)  - Ligne 89 (Luxembourg, Panthéon, Austerlitz Trainstation, ...)  - Ligne 82 (Champs de mars-tour Eiffel, Luxembourg, ...)  - Ligne 70 (Saint Germain des Près, Odéon, Pont-Neuf Ile de la cité, Châtelet, Hotel de Ville, ...)  - Ligne 28 (Alésia, Rond point des Champs-Élysées, gare Saint Lazare, ...)  You will find a nice interactive map on: RATP (dot) fr (slash) plan-interactif

name: Charmant pied-à-terre (2p) avec vue sur les toits
summary: Proche de la rue de Charonne et du Père Lachaise, ce pied-à-terre conjugue les avantages d’être à Paris et les plaisirs d’une vie de quartier. Les transports, bien desservis, vous conduiront en une vingtaine de minutes à République et à l’est du Marais. Vous l’apprécierez notamment pour son emplacement, sa vue et sa luminosité. Parfait pour les couples, les voyageurs en solo et les voyageurs d’affaires. Son charme réside dans le nid perché qu’il évoque, sous les toits de zinc, typiques de Paris.
space: Idéal pour une personne seule de passage à Paris ou un couple désireux de découvrir la capitale, ce petit pied-à-terre de deux pièces vous fera découvrir les charmes du 20 ème arrondissement. A quelques dizaines de minutes de marche du Père Lachaise, l’appartement offre une vue dégagée sur les toits parisiens, laissant apercevoir au loin le Sacré Coeur. Son plus, la lumière qui irradie en journée (dernier étage) et qui en fait un lieu de vie très cossu. Ainsi que son alcôve sous les toits de zinc qui font le charme de Paris.  Quelques petites indications sur les alentours : Bienvenu ! Voici quelques informations nécessaires concernant l’appartement et pour vous rendre le séjour plus agréable. METRO & TRANSPORTS :  Le plus proche : Alexandre Dumas ou Avron sur la Ligne 2 Plus bas en redescendant la rue Alexandre Dumas, la station Rue des Boulets sur la Ligne 9 qui conduit en peu de temps à République. Le bus Ligne76 conduit à Charonne et à Louvre. POUBELLES : Tri sélectif, à vous de voi

name: Charming Parisian Apartment in the Latin Quarter
summary: This charming, quiet apartment is situated in the heart of the Latin quarter of Paris. The apartment is right across from Jardin de Luxembourg, near the  Sorbonne University, and the Pantheon. This district, filled with lovely restaurants and Parisian boutiques is the place to be. You have direct railway access from the airport (RER B) to the apartment (Luxembourg Station).
space: The apartment is very centrally located, equipped with all basic amenities, with wooden floors and big windows that light up the living space. It is tastefully decorated and has a typically Parisian charm to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. There is a large living room with big, comfy sofa bed and a spacious bedroom equipped with lots of storage space. The kitchen is completely separated from the living space.

name: Cozy apartment in the chic district of Paris(16th)
summary: Charmant appartement (F2) en plein coeur du quartier chic de Paris (16ème arrondissement), à proximité du stade Parc des Princes et de Roland Garros. Cet appartement se trouve dans un immeuble moderne. Ce logement a toutes les commodités nécessaires pour vous permettre de passer un agréable séjour à Paris. Accessible par différents transports en commun (métro et bus), cet appartement bénéficie de commerces, à proximité.
space: L'appartement est très lumineux. Il est composé d'un séjour avec un grand canapé d'angle convertible en lit double. D'une cuisine américaine fonctionnelle, entièrement équipée (machine à laver, lave vaisselle, cafetière, plaques de cuisson, frigidaire ...) donnant sur le salon. D'une chambre à coucher très spacieuse avec un grand lit double et d'un grand dressing. D'une salle de bain très moderne (douche...). Logement équipée de la WIFI.

name: Cozy flat in the heart of the 11th (Bastille)
summary: Nice studio of 237 square feet in high-standing residency, in the area of Bastille's place / Voltaire. Really close to Rue de la Roquette, a really nice street with bars, cafés, shops... everything you need ! Great to party but to have quiet moments too (calm street near party area). The flat is well equipped and decorated as long as I live there all year long. If you come with you car, I have a private parking spot in the building ! Feel free to use it, I don't.
space: Living-room  : - Double sofa bed with very new and comfy mattress - Bench seat under the window, good view, perfect to read - Clean sheets, 3 pillows, quilt - TV et DVD blue-ray player/USB port (you can watch my dvd's) - Hi-fi system (you can put your music by plugging your phone usb cable directly on it ! Good sound) - Coffee table (where I have my meal) Kitchen side : - 2 electric stoves - Hoven - Coffee machine, Kettle - the, infusion & Nespresso-coffee capsules at your disposal - Juicer - Saucepans, Frying pans, Plates, glasses, mugs... in the cupboard - Sink / Dish drainer - Washing machine / Detergent / Drying area Bathroom : - Bathtube (warm water for 2/3 persons) - Clean towels at your disposal - WC - Sink / Big mirror - Products : soap, shower gel, shampoo, conditionner - Hair-dryer, hair ceramic plates - Speakers... because it's nice to listen to music when washing ! Other : - Private parking lot - Video interphone - Elevator - No wifi (but you can buy a 24h or 7days access w

neighborhood_overview: The 11th arrondissement is the hype area of Paris. Many cute streets around, stores, renowned restaurants, coffees, bars, wine bars, cavists, supermarkets (one is opened until midnight at 66 rue de la roquette), local and bio foodstores (a lot) !  Big market of "Saint-Sabin" on thursday and sunday morning (7am-2:30 pm). Seine river is very close as well.  Cultural : Opéra Bastille (the national opera of Paris for music/orchestra. Ballet is at Opéra Garnier. Movie theater - Cinéma MK2 Bastille Theater - 1 minute walking of Théâtre de la Bastille You'll love the neighborhood !
transit: Subway : "Voltaire" (line 9, the closest), "Breguet-Sabin" (line 5, 6 minutes walking), "Bastille" (line 1, 8, 5) Bus : Line 69, 56... Look for "Popincourt" or "Voltaire - Leon Blum" on (URL HIDDEN) Car : I can let you use my own private parking lot in the building (free).
access: You can use the whole flat (but not my personal stuffs obviously). I will be nearby, to my boyfriend's place.
interaction: I can help you with pleasure, give you advices, or stay discreet if you prefer so ! But I need to meet my guests for a trust matter, as I usually live in this apartment.

neighborhood_overview: We are in this neigbourhood for years now ad we really enjoy beeing here. A very pleasant walk is just very near on the Canal St. Martin.You can find very nice places to have a drink or to eat, when the weather is nice a lot of people are around the canal for a picknick!The street I love not so far away is Rue St Marthe, very colorfull. Here you can go for a drink or for a restaurant and you can't be desapointed. A very good gastronomic restaurant is just on the St Marthe square, it's called "Le Galopin". Otherwise we are not too far away from the Butte-Chaumont Parc or Belleville Parc.

The bus 75 and 46 are passing at the corner of our street. 15 minutes walk from Gare de l'Est or directly by bus 46.
interaction: Usually we rent our appartement during our hollydays so there is no interaction between us and the guests.
house_rules: Thank you so much for respecting our appartement !
host_about: I'm an artist, a photographer. I love Paris and my friend and I'd love to show you our beautiful city.

name: Old World Paris Luxury Apartment
summary: Spacious & airy (110 m2) - stunning old world Paris decor (parquet flooring, lofty living room windows, molded ceilings, fireplaces etc.) Facing a beautiful park allowing for breath of fresh air while remaining ideally located in the heart of Paris
space: The apartment has two bedrooms; the master bedroom has a king size bed with high end Treca mattress (brand new, orthopedic, anti-allergenic and very comfy!), the second bedroom is a child's room (i.e. is decorated as a child's room) - but boasts a double bed suitable for two adults (also a brand new high end Treca mattress). Duvets in both rooms are feather and down and there is one set of feather and down pillows and one set of orthopedic pillows - up to you who gets what! Our kitchen has a new induction stove (4 stoves), a fridge, oven, steaming (vapor) machine, dishwasher as well as a range of useful cooking utensils - ceramic knives, juicer, hand blender, herb chopper, foam maker etc. (we're French, we like to cook!). We have a bathroom with shower/bath and sink and a separate toilet room, also with sink. Other conveniences include a brand new high end washing machine (no drier, but we do have a free standing clothes air dryer), iron, ironing board, high speed wireless internet, br
description: Spacious & airy (110 m2) - stunning old world Paris decor (parquet flooring, lofty living room windows, molded ceilings, fireplaces etc.) Facing a beautiful park allowing for breath of fresh air while remaining ideally located in the heart of Paris The apartment has two bedrooms; the master bedroom has a king size bed with high end Treca mattress (brand new, orthopedic, anti-allergenic and very comfy!), the second bedroom is a child's room (i.e. is decorated as a child's room) - but boasts a double bed suitable for two adults (also a brand new high end Treca mattress). Our kitchen has a new induction stove (4 stoves), a fridge, oven, steaming (vapor) machine, dishwasher as well as a range of useful cooking utensils - ceramic knives, juicer, hand blender, herb chopper, foam maker etc. (we're French, we like to cook!). We have a bathroom
neighborhood_overview: Ideally located, our two bedroom apartment is situated in the 18th arrondissement of Paris – the same neighborhood that boasts the Sacré Coeur, Montmartre, Le Moulin Rouge and all that good stuff! The 18th is the artists quarter in Paris, with plenty of typical French theatres, cinemas, cafes, bars and restaurants to people watch from. The apartment gives onto a beautiful little park with a children’s play area (both living rooms give onto this park) – the greenery and peace and quiet when you walk out the door is a rare treat in urban Paris. The apartment is a 10-12 minute walk from Montmartre (or 5 mins on the metro if you are feeling lazy) and is equally convenient for those wishing to visit Pigalle, Barbès and Les Puces (the famous vintage flea market). La Rue du Poteau on our doorstep, is a typical Parisian street full of boulangeries, cheese shops, florists, fish stores, butchers shops, wine stores and gourmet food stores; also convenient and within walking distance (5 minutes) i
notes: NOTE: For stays of 1 night we will only charge a 30 Euro cleaning fee. AND FINALLY: For stays of 2 nights or longer, we'll throw in a bottle of French red to sweeten the deal. A bientôt!
transit: Our apartment is a 1 minute walk to the line 4 Metro and a 2.5 minute walk to the line 12 Metro, either of which take you to any other quarters you would like to visit in less than 20 minutes. From Gare du Nord Station: Line 4 Metro (takes 5 mins) From CDG Airport: RER Train to Chatelet and from there the Metro (Line 4) - approx. 45 minute travel time. Taxi from airport: 45/50 euros
access: Linens and towels are provided and we are happy for you to use our hair dryer and toiletries (shampoo/conditioner etc). Just bring your toothbrush!
interaction: We rent out the entire apartment, so you will have the space to yourself - however (unless we are on vacation) we will be never any more than 20-30 mins away should you need us for anything!
house_rules: No smoking, keep it calm, you break it - you buy it!
host_about: We work in finance and travel alot and so use our apartment for friends, family, exchanges and Airbnb rentals! We love our city and are delighted to be able to offer a comfortable base to discover Paris from :)

neighborhood_overview: Marx dormoy is the area that moves and evolves the more currently in Paris. Populated by artists and family, it is the result of a popular and jovial atmosphere. A cosmopolitan culture, coupled with the opening bar of all kinds (La Vieille Pie, The Populettes, coffee Olive), cafes and places to dance and art (Small Gouttes, 104. .)  If time is an appointment you enjoy playing Ping Pong near the spot where Havel an eco-garden just opened.
access: to subway: - Line 12 ( Marx Dormoy 5 mn) - Line 4 ( Marcadet Poissonnier 10mn) - Line 2 ( La chapelle 10 mn) RER B (direct access to Charles de Gaules airport) 15 minute walk.  Bus: Line 65 takes you directly into neighborhoods Republique and Bastille and the Gare de Lyon.
interaction: I welcome you personally and can meet all your needs and travel requests.
house_rules: I do not smoke and am very neat, so I appreciate receiving people who do not smoke inside my apartment
host_about:
Jeune femme dynamique et souriante, toujours à l'affut de partager des expériences humaines. J'aime parler ! J'aime raconter des histoires et faire rire. 
Scénariste de formation, mon imagination est débordante et mon écoute attentive, j'aime m'inspirer des gens que je rencontre.

Il est pratique d’y louer un appartement pour des vacances à Paris. Le quartier Poissonnière, à proximité des Grands-Boulevards Entre la rue du Faubourg Montmartre et le boulevard Magenta, s’étend le quartier Poissonnière. Idéalement situé, il jouxte à l’ouest le quartier de l’Opéra, ses monuments et ses grands magasins ; au sud le quartier Grands-Boulevards et ses nombreux théâtres. Vivant et multiculturel, ce quartier offre de nombreux petits restaurants à prix doux et des magasins d’alimentation français ou exotiques. Populaire et toujours affairé, le quartier Poissonnière conserve un peu de l’atmosphère des vieux faubourgs de Paris, pimentée par un brin de multiculturalisme. neighborhood_overview: This Left Bank neighborhood is one of the most sought-after area in Paris, in between the Quartier Latin and Montparnasse and has a vibrant cultural life, with an array  of delicious cafes and restaurants as well as various cinémas, theaters  and museums. It is 5' walk from the most beautiful park in Paris , le Jardin du Luxembourg and its famous puppet theater, promenades, cafes and basins .
notes: We would recommend the following lesser-known attractions  within 15' walk from the house: - Musée du Luxembourg -Musée Maillol -Cafe Les Deux Magots  -La Coupole restaurant  - La Pagode cinema - good shopping on rue de Sèvres , rue de Grenelle, rue St Sulpice and at the Bon Marché
transit: RER B is 5' walk leading to Gare du Nord, Charles de Gaulle and Orly airports; 3 subway lines and numerous bus lines leading to all the major touristic spots such as the Louvres, Champs Elysées, Tour Eiffel, are from a few minutes walk from the house.
access: Guests have access to the whole house, garden and terrace, including a fully equipped kitchen and laundry. A housekeeper comes every day. Wifi and TV available. BBQ available in the garden. Bicyles can be lent.
interaction: We will be welcoming our guests on their day of arrival. If away, our housekeeper will welcome our guests and give them a tour of the house.
house_rules: A housekeeper will be coming every day ( included in the price)  No smoking, no pet  An outside alarm  must be turned on and off
host_about: I am still active and like art and good food and wines. Our daughter , son in law and grand son live in Hackney. We regularly come and visit them.

name: Ch. Elysees Quiet, Large & Elegant
summary: This bright 19th century flat is close to the Arc de Triomphe in a very French neighbourhood, with quality shops and apartments. It enjoys a large living room, high ceilings & was redecorated 2 years ago with modern fittings .
space: This is an elegant & recently redecorated 75 sq m (800 sq ft) apartment in a traditional 19th century Parisian building. It is bright, very quiet, and enjoys high ceilings, tasteful decoration and fittings - all carried out 2 years or so ago. There is a substantial living room, (with a large sofa bed), a desk area, and it is decorated with family portraits and more modern paintings too. An occasional folding bed is also available The apartment is 5 minutes (300 yards) from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees, and is located on the 2nd floor with a lift. It faces onto a quiet street, with one double bedroom and spacious closets, The modern bathroom has been finished in renewable tropical woods with pale teak predominating. There is, of course,  a bath and separate shower.  The kitchen is fully equipped, and has a rustic table in the dining area which can take 8 guests (10 with a squeeze !) Between the dining area and the Lift there is a guest washroom.  The apartment is generally

There is, of course,  a bath and s
neighborhood_overview: This is a desirable neighbourhood; very French, friendly and safe ! It is regularly patrolled in view of neighbouring foreign legations nearby. While it is located in a  desirable residential area of Paris, there are shops and good restaurants nearby: The remarkable Poncelet market is 200 yards away, just off the Avenue des Ternes where you will find some of the highest quality food specialities in Paris. (as well as the more everyday requirements) Slightly further away is the Faubourg St Honore with its luxury brands: Dior, Hermes etc. On a more basic level, there is a friendly  general grocery open until midnight just 40 yards from the building and a large general store a further 3 minutes away (this is Monoprix also in Avenue des Ternes) Many other shops and good value restaurants are found locally.  I can give you more information once you complete your booking. Like nearly all neighbouring houses, the building is in the traditional Haussman 19th century residential  style which yo
notes: A cleaning and laundry charge is payable by the guest directly to the housekeeper : it is 60 euros per stay or per week (whichever shorter) and you pay her directly on arrival. Thank you in advance for your help in this, as it is not economical to send small amounts to her by telegraphic transfer !    Please indicate  the names of adult guests, and childen ( & DOB if less than 17 years old) Grateful if you would report  any equipment failure to the housekeeper The minimum stay is normally 4 nights.   Arrivals and departures are by arrangement to fit in with the guest's travel plans as far as is possible. Guideline arrival times are between 4,30 & 7 pm, and departures from 8,30 to 10 am. Grateful if you can  email with your with your estimated arrival  times, and call the housekeeper on airport arrival in Paris; my recommended driver can do this if required And Finally - don't forget to send a friendly positive report to Airbnb (if justified !) . Thank you for your custom , and enjoy yo
transit: The apartment is 200 yards from the bus stop of for the Airport (CDG) bus / coach at the Champs Elysees. A taxi will take between 30 and 90 minutes to both Paris airports, but this will  depend on the time of day you travel !  Local transport is easy with the Metro (subway) 200 yards away at Ch. de Gaulle/Etoile and the suburban Lines (RER) Bus stops to many parts of town are nearby. A car park is right opposite the property  entrance.
access: You will be welcomed by my very friendly housekeeper, who lives 40 yards away She will give you keys, show you round,  and provide further  information. I can give you full arrival arrangements once you confirm the booking. I can also arrange for you to be met by a dedicated cab driver at the airport air station who speaks English, and can take you straight to the apartment. The rates are competitive.  As is common in many Paris buildings, a security entry code is needed in the main entrance if you arrive before 9 am and after 6 pm. or at weekends & public holidays. The whole apartment is available to you, though there is small locked cupboard with the owner's personal effects.
interaction: The housekeeper will ensure you have fresh sheets and a clean the flat on arrival. Her English is limited, but quite understandable. Please phone me if there are any misunderstandings, and let me know if there is failure in the quality of the apartment on arrival. But I have to say there have been no complaints to date !
house_rules: Reasonable House Rules exist !  Please consider them  seriously to avoid upset and expense ... If you move furniture, please put it back as it was originally before departure No smoking, please ! Evidence of smoking can incur heavy additional charges, as can the use of illegal substances. Small pets are occasionally possible, but always check in advance Keep noise levels down, particularly evenings (EMAIL HIDDEN)plaints from neighbours can provoke a police visit (it has happened !) and can prejudice your security deposit ! Do not allow more than the agreed number of guests to stay at the apartment overnight. Grateful if you can report  any equipment failure.  As mentioned, there is a 60 euro charge for laundry and cleaning payable on arrival to the housekeeper and every fortnight thereafter Minimum stay over Christmas and Easter is 7 nights Finally - don't forget to send a friendly  report to Airbnb if justified. Thank you in advance for your custom, and I wish you a happy  stay in Par
host_about:
I am an economist, originally from Scotland, educated in Engalnd, and now living happily  in Mexico with my wife, a sucessful magazine editor. We  make regular visits to Europe. My children now have their own homes, so our family home and flat are available for guests to enjoy from time to time. They have been well cared for and modernised. to a high standard

My priorities are family and friends, whom we entertain frequently. I also enjoy music and literature, and have sometimes been described as an amateur linguist and gourmet. I am  sports enthusiast - fencing, golf and tennis, though sadly I now participate in some of these less actively.

My wife  has an academic bent, and has a particular love for the arts and architecture, both modern and classical. This is possibly nurtured by her family traditions which go back some centuries in Southern Italy and Burgundy.

My mother in law is an interior decorator of repute, and has carried out important commissions in France, USA and Mexico. She is a French aristocrat, and the inspiration for the charm and comfort of our homes, which we cherish.

I am confident you will enjoy them too !

name: CHARMANT APPARTEMENT DE 43M2
summary: Très bel appartement cosy de 43m2 dans une belle résidence du 20ème arrondissement. Situé tout près du métro Gambetta et de nombreux commerces...L'appartement est à environ 10 minutes à pied du cimetière du Père Lachaise..
space: Appartement très mignon et très calme situé au deuxième étage avec ascenseur. La chambre est située côté cour, ce qui vous assure calme et tranquillité durant votre séjour. Je peux accueillir jusqu'à 4 personnes durant le séjour avec le grand lit pour 2 et un canapé-lit pouvant aussi accepter 2 autres personnes..
description: Très bel appartement cosy de 43m2 dans une belle résidence du 20ème arrondissement. Situé tout près du métro Gambetta et de nombreux commerces...L'appartement est à environ 10 minutes à pied du cimetière du Père Lachaise.. Appartement très mignon et très calme situé au deuxième étage avec ascenseur. La chambre est située côté cour, ce qui vous assure calme et tranquillité durant votre séjour. Je peux accueillir jusqu'à 4 personnes durant le séjour avec le grand lit pour 2 et un canapé-lit pouvant aussi accepter 2 autres personnes.. L'appartement est entièrement équipé avec télévision et internet, wifi.. La cuisine est équipée d'un four, d'un frigidaire, d'un micro-ondes, plaque vitrocéramique, congélateur, lave linge et lave vaisselle...Entièrement équipé !! Je serais heureux de vous accueillir à votre arrivée pour vous présenter l'appartement et vous montrer sur un plan comment circuler dans Paris avec les transports en commun ainsi que des recommandations sur les commerces et restaur
neighborhood_overview: Le quartier est très agréable pour ses nombreux commerces typiquement français avec ses boulangeries, boucheries, fromagers, primeurs et ses étals de fruits et légumes... que des produits frais et sains.. Pour des courses plus basiques, un magasin Franprix se trouve dans ma rue et un monoprix un peu plus loin.. Mais je vous indiquerez tout çà lors de votre arrivée.. il y a de nombreux bus qui desservent la ville pour vous rendre dans les différents quartiers de Paris et vous pouvez aller à pied au cimetière du Père Lachaise pour y découvrir les tombes de nombreuses personnalités...
notes: J'ai habité dans ce charmant appartement pendant 15 ans et je m'y suis senti vraiment très bien. J'ai dû partir suite à un démenagement pour un plus grand logement mais suis fier de le louer et de le faire partager à des touristes..
transit: Pour venir chez moi depuis l'aéroport d'Orly, prendre l'orlyval jusqu'au terminus Antony puis le RER B jusqu'à Chatelet les halles. Descendre pour prendre le métro ligne 4 Direction porte de Clignancourt et descendre à Réaumur Sébastopol. Vous devez prendre la correspondance pour la ligne 3 direction Gambetta et descendre à l'arrêt Gambetta. De là, je viendrais vous chercher.. En provenance de Roissy Charles de Gaulle, vous avez le Roissy bus qui s'arrête aux terminaux 1 et 3 et qui vous amène directement jusqu'à l'Opéra Garnier de Paris (1h de trajet).  De là, prendre la ligne 3 du métro direction Gallieni et descendre à l'arrêt Gambetta. Je viendrais vous chercher sur place.  Si vous venez en voiture, je ne possède malheureusement pas de parking et il faudra trouver une place dans la rue..
access: L'appartement est entièrement équipé avec télévision et internet, wifi.. La cuisine est équipée d'un four, d'un frigidaire, d'un micro-ondes, plaque vitrocéramique, congélateur, lave linge et lave vaisselle...Entièrement équipé !!
interaction: Je serais heureux de vous accueillir à votre arrivée pour vous présenter l'appartement et vous montrer sur un plan comment circuler dans Paris avec les transports en commun ainsi que des recommandations sur les commerces et restaurants du quartier..
house_rules: J'attends bien sûr de faire de belles rencontres. Les locataires auront bien sûr le devoir de respecter les lieux tout en se sentant chez eux. Il est bien sûr possible de fumer dans l'appartement ou sur le balcon.. par contre, les animaux ne sont malheureusement pas autorisés..
street: Père Lachaise - Ménilmontant, Paris, Île-de-France 75020, France

name: Charmant studio Gambetta/Jourdain
summary: Agréable studio, calme et très lumineux, au 4ème étage d'une résidence située entre Jourdain et Gambetta.
space: Idéal pour déposer ses valises un week end à paris ! Le studio se trouve rue des Pyrénées, à deux pas du Père Lachaise, du Parc de Belleville, du quartier animé de Ménilmontant. Toute l'authenticité de l'Est de Paris !  Vous trouverez tout ce dont vous avez besoin pour passer un agréable séjour, des commerçants authentiques, des librairies, des cafés sympathiques, un marché au pied de l'immeuble. Le soir vous pourrez profiter des lieux de concerts aux alentours, la Bellevilloise, la Maroquinerie, la Flèche d'Or... En prenant le métro à Gambetta ou à Jourdain, vous serez en plein de coeur de Paris en à peine moins de 10 min (République, Beaubourg…)

name: Joli 2-pièces proche Montmartre
summary: Appartement calme et lumineux dans un quartier romantique et vivant. Vous y trouverez tout le confort pour passer un agréable séjour! Proche commerces et terrasses, avec un accès direct au Vélib' et Métro. Peut accueillir 2 à 4 personnes.
space: Notre appartement donne sur une cour intérieure ce qui vous permettra d'être au calme lors de vos soirées. Il est très lumineux la journée.
description: Appartement calme et lumineux dans un quartier romantique et vivant. Vous y trouverez tout le confort pour passer un agréable séjour! Proche commerces et terrasses, avec un accès direct au Vélib' et Métro. Peut accueillir 2 à 4 personnes. Notre appartement donne sur une cour intérieure ce qui vous permettra d'être au calme lors de vos soirées. Il est très lumineux la journée. L'appartement est proche des transports en communs et de stations de Vélib', ce qui vous rapprochera encore plus vite des activités touristiques (Montmartre, Pigalle, Marché des Batignolles, Puces de Saint-Ouen...). Nous préférons louer l'appartement en entier pour que vous soyez le plus à l'aise possible lors de votre séjour. Dans ce cas-ci, nous ne pourrons être présents qu'à l'entrée et la sortie. Cependant, ma colocataire ou moi pourrons parfois être présentes dans une des chambres de l'appartement et par conséquent disponibles pour vous aidez dans vos visites de la ville. Nous parlons anglais toutes les deux
neighborhood_overview: Le quartier est très vivant et hétéroclite. Vous y trouverez d'un côté toute l'effervescence de la vie de quartier à Paris et de l'autre, ses endroits calmes et romantiques, typiques de la ville des amoureux.
transit: L'appartement est idéalement situé pour les gares!  Gare Saint Lazare et Gare Montparnasse sur la ligne 13 Gare du Nord et de Gare de l'Est sur la ligne 2. Je ne recommande par contre pas la voiture car les places de parkings sont chères!
access: L'appartement est proche des transports en communs et de stations de Vélib', ce qui vous rapprochera encore plus vite des activités touristiques (Montmartre, Pigalle, Marché des Batignolles, Puces de Saint-Ouen...).
interaction: Nous préférons louer l'appartement en entier pour que vous soyez le plus à l'aise possible lors de votre séjour. Dans ce cas-ci, nous ne pourrons être présents qu'à l'entrée et la sortie. Cependant, ma colocataire ou moi pourrons parfois être présentes dans une des chambres de l'appartement et par conséquent disponibles pour vous aidez dans vos visites de la ville. Nous parlons anglais toutes les deux et serons très contentes de vous aidez!
house_rules: Il est possible de fumer dans les pièces de l'appartement mais nous vous demanderons de toujours bien aérer!  Il est également demandé de respecter le calme de l'immeuble et de faire preuve de discrétion auprès de nos voisins.

neighborhood_overview: At the corner of our street, there are a lot of very good restaurants and cafés with terraces. A few steps away from there, la rue de Bretagne is the shopping heart for fine food with the older covered market of Paris, the "Marché des enfants rouges", a deluxe food market which is equipped to fill the emptiest of stomachs with its impressive range of Italian, Lebanese, African, Japanese and other stalls... there's also plenty of artisanal and organic food stalls. Definitely one of the more atmospheric of Paris’s food markets! A little farther you can find art galleries and lots of cool shops that remain open on sunday. While strolling in the Marais, you will also discover some of the most beautiful historic monuments of Paris. Our place is also just a few steps from the Carreau du Temple, an old and unique covered Market that has been completely restored in the last years to be redeveloped as a beautiful and design multipurpose space with sport and cultural facilities. host_about:
Bonjour à tous, 

Si vous souhaitez marcher sur les traces d'Amélie Poulain, découvrir le Paris bohème et les bistroquets des buttes Montmartre, ne cherchez plus, vous y êtes. Nous vivons dans un très bel appartement du 9ème arrondissement à 3 minutes du métro Anvers et du Sacré Cœur. Nous vous recevrons avec un grand plaisir pour vous faire découvrir la culture française et vous faire profiter des bons plans parisiens, expositions, restaurants.. Si vous aimez la gastronomie française, on pourra voir faire découvrir quelques-unes de nos spécialités.

A très bientôt,
Pablo et Victoria

Hello everyone,

If you want to walk in the footsteps of Amelie Poulain, discover the bohemian Paris and Montmartre bistroquets mounds, look no further, you're there. We live in a very nice apartment in the 9th arrondissement 3 minutes from Anvers Metro and the famous "Sacré Cœur". We will welcome you with great pleasure to make you discover French culture and make you enjoy the good Parisian shots, exhibitions, restaurants .. If you love French cuisine, we will share with you some of our specialties.

See you soon,
Pablo and Victoria

name: COSY PENTHOUSE NEAR PARK&CANAL
summary: BOOKING 7DAYS MIN. Closeby a gorgeous Park, a 110 sqm penthouse, with 3 rooms (2 double, 1 with 2 single beds + 2 mezzanines) and 2 bathrooms, can host up to 9 pax. neighborhood_overview: Our penthouse is located just 1mn away from the Buttes Chaumont Park, a beautiful Belle Epoque park with cascades, little paths swirling aroung a wide lake. The park features 3 restaurants (including the famous Rosa Bonheur, ideal for brunches on sunday... or nightclubbing on saturdays), an open air children's theatre (Guignol), swings, playgrounds... With a 5 minutes walk, you can reach the Canal, with its two cinemas, and the many barges that offer a wide range of distractions (concerts, exhibitions, happenings, etc.) Check also the brand new Maison des Canaux, on the canal, for a sunset drink on the banks, and le Point Ephémère, a concert hall that hosts many uprising groups in the french capital. With the metro, Montmartre is 10' away, the Marais is 15' away. And during summertime : enjoy PARIS PLAGES, Paris' free beaches on the Seine riverbanks !!!
notes: Our penthouse is located just 1mn away from the Buttes Chaumont Park, a beautiful Belle Epoque park with cascades, little paths swirling aroung a wide lake. The park features 3 restaurants (including the famous Rosa Bonheur, ideal for brunches on sunday... or nightclubbing on saturdays), an open air children's theatre (Guignol), swings, playgrounds... With a 5 minutes walk, you can reach the Canal, with its two cinemas, and the many barges that offer a wide range of distractions (concerts, exhibitions, happenings, etc.) and during the summer : PARIS PLAGE !! Beaches on the river Seine, at stone's throw. Check also the brand new Maison des Canaux, on the canal, for a sunset drink on the banks, and le Point Ephémère, a concert hall that hosts many uprising groups in the french capital. With the metro, Montmartre is 10' away, the Marais is 15' away.
transit: From Charles de Gaulle airport, take the RER until Gare du Nord, change for line 5 and step out at Laumière. It takes no more than a half hour from the airport to our place. From Orly, still the same : RER until Gare du Nord, then change for line 5.
access: Our appartment is filled with art, paintings, photographies, sculptures. We only have wifi, no TV is offered, we know that usually our guests prefer bringing their own PC or tablet. You are welcome to borrow one of the many books of our library. There is also an english section and an italian section, for those who do not want to carry to much weight !
interaction: We know pretty well our neighbourhood, and like to discuss with our guests... but will only interact if asked to !
house_rules: Treat our house as if it was yours. And do not hesitate to ask, we'll be happy to help !
host_about:
I am a film maker, I live in Paris but travel a lot. I am in my mid-thirties, I have a daughter, Alba and am married to Jean-Paul, a reporter too. We rent our appartment while we are away on reportages : sometimes it's three months in a row, sometimes it's only three days. it depends ! 
When we are here, we love welcoming my guests ! If we are not, we remain easily reachable... Bienvenue chez nous !

name: Sunny, charming and child-friendly
summary: This bright and comfy flat could be your perfect base for discovering Paris. It accommodates 2+2 and has all necessary amenities. It is located in the 15th district, 8 min. from 3 metro lines; bike station, supermarket and bakery next door.
space: It is a very cosy flat where I live most of the time. The flat is available for rent during holidays and long weekends. The flat is bright and warm and is ideal for a couple or a family of four or five.

The flat is available for rent during holidays and long weekends. The flat is bright and warm and is ideal for a couple or a family of four or five. There aren't many tourist attractions in the immediate vicinity but you are no more than 20 min away from the very centre of the city. The charming 14th district is 10 minutes away and even Monmartre is a on a direct line. Usually I would be there to meet you and explain you a couple of things but then I would be absent during your stay. In case I am not there it is the cleaning lady who will meet you. neighborhood_overview: The flat is close to a supermarket open 7 days per week as well as a bakery. About 10 min from the flat there is a public park - George Brassens. The flat is not far from park Monsouris.
notes: When I am not in the flat for longer periods of time it is in my interest to rent it out for longer stays. If you are interested in longer stays (especially July and August) I can give you a special price.

summary: Appartement de 25m2, au cœur du 18e arrondissement, situé au pied de la butte de Montmartre et du Sacré Coeur. Proche de toutes les commodités. Très calme, donnant sur l'un des jardinets de l'immeuble . Confortable et entièrement équipé.
space: L’appartement, muni d’un digicode, au quatrième étage (sans ascenseur), est très fonctionnel : un coin nuit avec un lit double de 140, un coin repas avec une cuisine aménagée, et une salle de bain avec une douche et des WC.
description: Appartement de 25m2, au cœur du 18e arrondissement, situé au pied de la butte de Montmartre et du Sacré Coeur. Proche de toutes les commodités. Très calme, donnant sur l'un des jardinets de l'immeuble . Confortable et entièrement équipé. L’appartement, muni d’un digicode, au quatrième étage (sans ascenseur), est très fonctionnel : un coin nuit avec un lit double de 140, un coin repas avec une cuisine aménagée, et une salle de bain avec une douche et des WC. La totalité de l'appartement est à votre disposition à l'exception de quelques placards contenant les affaires personnelles. Comme je suis très souvent en déplacement, il est malheureusement  peu probable que je puisse être présente à votre arrivée (des amis donnent souvent un petit coup de mains!). Par contre, je serai très certainement présente au moment de votre départ et entièrement disponible par téléphone pendant toute la durée de votre séjour! L'appartement se situe au cœur du 18e arrondissement, dans le quartier de la  Mairi
neighborhood_overview: L'appartement se situe au cœur du 18e arrondissement, dans le quartier de la  Mairie du 18e. Il se trouve donc à 15 minutes à pied du Sacré Cœur et de la Place du Tertre et aussi à 15 minutes à pied des Puces de Saint-Ouen. C'est un quartier très vivant et chaleureux, avec toutes les commodités :  restaurants, bars, salons de thé, épiceries, boulangeries, supermarchés, commerces de bouche (fromagers, bouchers, charcutiers, poissonniers, traiteurs), mais aussi librairies, boutique SNCF, presse, Poste...  On y trouve aussi de plus en plus de boutiques de créateurs : bijoux, meubles, vélos, antiquités...
transit: Métro : deux stations à 5 minutes à pied  Jules Joffrin (ligne 12 -) et Simplon (ligne 4- ).   Bus : plusieurs lignes à 5 minutes à pied  Montmartrobus : Mairie du 18e / Bd de Clichy : arrêt Mairie du 18e  n° 80- Mairie du 18e/Porte de Versailles : arrêt Mairie du 18e  n°60- Porte de Montmartre/ Gambetta : arrêt Mairie du 18e  n°95- Mairie de Saint-Ouen/ Porte de Vanves : arrêt rue Ordener n°31-  Gare de l'Est/ Ch. de Gaulle Etoile : arrêt Mairie du 18e  n°56- Porte de Clignancourt/ Château de Vincennes : arrêt bd Ornano Vélib' : Plusieurs stations sur un périmètre de 5 minutes à pied.  Autolib' : une station quasiment à l'entrée de l'immeuble, sur le même trottoir.  En voiture :  Pour venir : Porte de Clignancourt. Pour se garer : des places de stationnement payantes aux pieds de l'immeuble ainsi que dans les rues alentours. Possibilité de trouver assez facilement.  Un parking souterrain payant est aussi disponible au coin de la rue.
access: La totalité de l'appartement est à votre disposition à l'exception de quelques placards contenant les affaires personnelles.

Par contre, je serai très certainement présente au moment de votre départ et entièrement disponible par téléphone pendant toute la durée de votre séjour!

summary: Here in Oberkampf, this is as good the day as the night!
space: Down by the metro Oberkampf & in the center of Paris, the one I love. Bonjour, 
Je suis Lina, comédienne & chanteuse. J'ai écrit un spectacle "LA CLEF DE GAÏA" . J'aime les gens, l'autre et j'aime les savoir heureux. 
Bien manger, bien dormir, se perdre dans la ville pour rencontrer et découvrir, voilà le secret d'un bon voyage.

name: Architect's apartment/ Light & airy
summary: Beautiful airy apartment in the best located spot of Paris, 1 block to everything like the trendy Le Marais & hipster hang-out Canal Saint-Martin. The apartment is well lit on the top floor and furnished in famous Italian and French design pieces.
space: The 32m2 apartment is located on the top floor of a building on a quiet, small street. Beautiful natural light floods through three windows with direct exposure to south, east and west.  I have been living in the apartment for 3 years, over which time I have collected several unique Italian and French design pieces like Angelo Mangiarotti, Jean Prouvé and Charlotte Périot. It features authentic wooden parquet floorboards and two original marble fireplaces - one in the living room, and another in the bedroom. The 32m2 bright and airy apartment is located on the top (5th) floor of a building in a small, quiet street. Beautiful natural light pours into the south, east and west facing windows. The apartment features authentic parquet wooden floorboards and two original marble fireplaces.
description: Beautiful airy apartment in the best located spot of Paris, 1 block to everything like the trendy Le Marais & hipster hang-out Canal Saint-Martin. The apartment is well lit on the top floor and furnished in famous Italian and French design pieces. The 32m2 apartment is located on the top floor of a building on a quiet, small street. Beautiful natural light floods through three windows with direct exposure to south, east and west.  I have been living in the apartment for 3 years, over which time I have collected several unique Italian and French design pieces like Angelo Mangiarotti, Jean Prouvé and Charlotte Périot. It features authentic wooden parquet floorboards and two original marble fireplaces - one in the living room, and another in the bedroom. The 32m2 bright and airy apartment is located on the top (5th) floor of a building in a small, quiet street. Beautiful natural light pours into the south, east and west facing windows. The apartment features authentic parquet wooden floor
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in an up-and-coming fringe neighbourhood bourgeoning with fantastic places to dine and shop, with a new venue opening practically every other week. You won’t be short of choice. Just metres from my doorstep is the trendy NoMa (North Marais) district where you’ll find the famous Marché des enfants rouge and across the road, a charming english-style park complete with lake and rotunda. You will also have abundant access to arguably the best restaurants, small galleries, shops, cafes and cocktail bars synonymous with Le Marais.  Only 600m to the north is the popular hipster haunt, Canal Saint-Martin. As well as being a pleasant place to take a stroll by the very photogenic canal, the area offers a fantastic selection of edgy cafes and restaurants of note. To the west of my apartment, all within 10 or 15 minutes walk, is the Parc de Belleville (with an amazing view over the city sans tourists), the Père-Lachaise cemetery and the popular night-time area on Rue Oberk
notes: I live in the apartment with my cat. She will not be there over the duration of your stay, however, please keep in mind that even though I will have the apartment professionally cleaned before your arrival, if you suffer from extreme allergies, it may not be the best option for you.
transit: My apartment is conveniently located immediately adjacent to two metro stations servicing three vital lines for traversing Paris. Line 8 - Filles du Calvaire (3 mins walk) Lin(URL HIDDEN)Oberkampf (1 min walk) Not much farther away is metro Parmentier and the major metro interchange station, République. Lines 3, 5, 8, 9 & 11 - République (8 mins walk) Line 3 - Parmentier (8 mins walk)
access: I will be contactable by telephone for the whole duration of your stay should you require any assistance with anything related to the apartment or even if you would simply like a good restaurant recommendation.
interaction: I live with a small cat, who will of course not be there during your stay. I will have the apartment professionally cleaned prior to your arrival, however, if you suffer from any severe allergies please do bear this in mind when booking.
house_rules: No smoking within the apartment, nor within the stairwell. No noise after 11pm. My neighbours are in their 80s and while tolerant, certainly expect peace and quiet to sleep. Please respect my possessions and keep everything where it belongs.
host_about: From Paris, into design & art.

summary: Close to Place d'Italie Avenue des Gobelins, walk to Jardin des Plantes, this flat has a true left bank feeling. French windows and new fully equipped kitchen with all necessities, this bright one bedroom is ideal for a couple or 2 friends.
space: Close to Place d'Italie (150m), Avenue des Gobelins, 5mns walk from Jardin des Plantes and the Seine, you can catch more than 5 metro lines and 7 buses with restaurants, shops, cinemas, close to the river and rue Mouffetard (10mns walk). Short bus ride or cycle to the famous quartier Latin, you'll be delighted to discover the luscious food market on tues-friday-sunday just around the corner (boulevard Blanqui). The apartment is 33sqm, one big bedroom, it is very bright and cozy, fully equipped with a separated kitchen and a bathroom with bathtub and washing machine. Has Wifi and TV international free phone, it has a big room with a double sofa + separate mattress to add a guest. Harwood floors and high ceiling, and 2 double full height windows, will give you the full parisian experience for your vacation.

summary: Cozy, quiet and bright 45 m² (485 sq ft) apartment in a residential and ritzy area of the 16 district, right by Porte Dauphine. Flat is fully furnished and includes a balcony on to a green square, a living room, bedroom, kitchen and bathroom.
space: A bright, quiet, convenient and cozy apartment in the West end of Paris.  You will find everything you need to enjoy your stay :  -A bedroom with a king size bed, closet with ample space for your things -Living room with a big couch and a flat screen TV, wifi  -Kitchen fully furnished (big fridge, freezer, microwave, nespresso coffee machine, stove… help yourselves to nibbles, drinks, and coffee)  -Bathroom with a bath tub / shower, amenities and washing machine  -Balcony with a green and sunny view...  The area is beautiful, safe, quiet and a heartbeat away from anything you want visit in Paris. The closest tube station is a 2-3 min walk (Porte Dauphine line 2 / RER line C / bus). Victor Hugo avenue is a 5 min walk away, and Trocadero (Eiffel tower) and the Champs Elysees are about 10 min away. neighborhood_overview: 16 district of Paris (west side of paris) The area is really nice, secure, quiet and really close to the center of Paris  Close : -Supermarket : 2 mins away (open Monday to Saturday til 9 pm and Sunday til 1pm)  -Bakery: Try 'Bechu' on Victor Hugo  -Restaurants:  If it is sunny you should go to 'il cottage' - they have a nice terrace about a min away from the apartment. Also try 'Paris 16' on rue des belles feuilles for best italian pastas. Up for a 15-20 min walk (or take the tube 2 stops to Ternes) and have the best piece de boeuf and baba au rhum ever at 'Les Gourmets des Ternes'.   -Arc de triomphe / avenue des champs elysés : 10-15 mins away -Trocadero / Eiffel tower : 10-15 mins away  -Lake Bois de boulogne : 15 mins away (Bois is less than 5 min away)
notes: I leave a  notice book inside my flat with all the main things you would need to know (wifi, how the electronics work...)  Of course feel free to reach me anytime
transit: Underground :  -Line 2 (porte dauphine) : 2 mins away by walk -RER C (avenue Foch) : 2 mins away by walk
access: The entire flat
interaction: You can reach me anytime and if I m not available my close friend from Paris (Joanna Leclerc) who is a "super host" on air bnb and is taking care of my flat during my travels, would be happy to help you and give you all the information you need. She has access to my account too so it is easier for all of us
house_rules: Smoking on the balcony only please Feel free to help yourself to anything in the fridge, coffee, tea .. Also there is some soap, shower gel, and toilet paper in the bathroom
host_about:
I am 33 years old, and have recently taken up a job that requires that I travel frequently to the GCC. 
I love Paris, especially this area where I've lived for the past 10 years. I am also in love with my sunny flat. It pains me to leave this often, but I feel much better knowing that others on airbnb can share some happiness in this home. 
Enjoy your stay in Paris and please feel free to contact me if you re interested.

Gare du Nord n'est pas un quartier très touristique, mais un endroit parfait pour bouger dans Paris pendant un week-end.  The neighborhood is very close from a lot of beautiful places (Montmartre, Pigalle, République, Canal St Martin, Canal de l'Ourcq). You have a supermarket and a bread factory just down the street.  Gare du Nord is not very touristique, but it's perfect if you want to visit Paris for a weekend.
transit: Gare du Nord est une station très centrale, où se croisent les lignes 5 et 4 du métro (cette dernière traverse paris du nord au sud)  Il y a également des stations vélib juste à côté.  Gare du Nord is a very central station where the lines 5 et 4 of the subway cross. You can also find Velib nearby.
access: Vous pouvez utiliser la cuisine, la salle de bain et le salon. Vous aurez une étagère libre dans le frigo si vous souhaitez faire des courses.  You can use the kitchen, the bathroom and the living room. You will have a free stand in the refrigirator if you want to buy some food.
interaction: Je ne serai pas à Paris les we où vous serez présents, mais je serai disponible à tout moment par téléphone si vous avez des questions. Mes colocataires pourront également y répondre.  I won't be in Paris the we when you will be there, but i will be available by phone anytime, if you have questions. My roomates will also be able to answer you.

Le quartier Strasbourg-St Denis est idéal pour une visite de Paris. Au centre de la capitale, mais sans être touristique, c'est un quartier en plein essor. On y trouve un grande variété de café et restaurants (français, indiens, turcs, vietnamiens..., notamment dans la rue du Faubourg-St-Denis et des Petites Ecuries),et ces nombreux passages contribuent à son charme . La station de métro Strasbourg St Denis ( Lignes 4, 8 et 9) est à 2 min, à une station de métro de République (Lignes 11, 8, 9, 3), à deux stations de la gare du Nord (RER B et D). Le quartier est donc très bien relié au reste de Paris.

host_about:
Welcome to "My Boutique Home in Paris - Luxury Furnished Apartments

About us
"My Boutique Home" was set up to provide an alternative to a typical hotel stay and  help our guests experience life a little more" like a local" rather than a tourist.
Our apartments have all the comfort of a deluxe hotel but have  the added advantage of having their own kitchens and living areas. They are all situated amongst the indigenous community allowing you to have a true Parisian experience during your stay!

Why are we different? Because "My Boutique Home" is owned and managed by renowned hoteliers so you can be assured of a comfortable stay. As seasoned travellers ourselves we understand the need for real comfort and to experience something different from the cookie cutter style hotel formula.
Our beautifully designed and maintained properties have been created as an "understated luxury living experience" and we believe that they are a real "home away from home"

This coupled with the high standards of cleanliness and maintenance means that we are confident that we are some of the best in the business.

Finally our carefully selected unique and interesting locations  ensure that you can really live the life of a local whilst being in the heart of the city

host_about:
J'habitant sur Paris depuis de nombreuses années. Je ne me lasse pas d'y vivre et j'admire au quotidien la beauté et les richesses de la "Ville Lumières".

Basé dans le Marais, j'aime la vie et le dynamisme de ce quartier qui présente tant de facettes :
Intéressé par l'Histoire, je m'émerveille toujours de l'architecture du quartier historique de Paris avec ses ruelles du Moyen-Age et ses nombreux Hôtels Particuliers des XVI et XVII siècles.
Fan d'art contemporain, je me rends régulièrement dans les différents musées (musée Georges Pompidou, musée Picasso) et aux vernissages de mes galeries préférées. 

J'ai vécu dans de nombreuses capitales et j'aime beaucoup voyager pour découvrir le monde.
A chacun de mes retours j’admire et j'apprécie la qualité de la vie parisienne.
Le Marais est un quartier vivant que l'on compare souvent à un "village". La rencontre avec ses habitants, la découverte des petites boutiques, les nombreux bars et le choix de petits restaurants gastronomiques participent à ce plaisir de vivre à Paris.

Je prends toujours un grand plaisir à accueillir mes hôtes, à leurs recommander les meilleurs adresses et faciliter leur séjour afin que comme moi ils trouvent rapidement leur place dans la vie du quartier et se sentent très vite chez eux à Paris.

Un cinéma MK2, deux théâtres, un parc, des restaurants et des bars autour.  Les mercredis et les samedis c'est le marché à deux pas de l'appartement. Par ailleurs, c'est un quartier entouré de quelques sites emblématiques comme les salles de concert de la Bellevilloise, la Maroquinerie, la Flèche d'Or et le restaurant Mama Shelter (restaurant aménagé par Philippe Starck). neighborhood_overview: Jardin des Plantes, a green oasis in Paris Rent a property near the Jardin des Plantes and choose a lively district of Paris that is great for walking and relaxing. Family-oriented and refreshing With a population of almost 19,000, the Jardin des Plantes district is a particularly lively part of Paris and a great place to live. The green spaces near the Seine exude calm and relaxation. Particularly popular with families, a lot of Parisians also come here to take a walk with friends. Close to the student life of the Latin Quarter, the streets around Jardin des Plantes are located between Boulevard Saint-Marcel and the Seine.
transit: An accessible neighborhood With a relatively central position, the Jardin des Plantes district has good public transportation services. Metro line 7 stops at the Censier-Daubenton, Place Monge, and Jussieu stations. The Gare d’Austerlitz train station provides access to the RER C and metro lines 5 and 10. The closer you get to Rue Mouffetard and the Latin Quarter, the more restaurants there are.

neighborhood_overview: Little more ... This pedestrian street is at 1 minute away from mythical coffees such as Café de Flore, Café "Les Deux Magots", La Palette or the Bar du Marché.   Within 10 minutes walking distance, you embrace: the Golden Triangle (the Louvre, Place Concorde, Opera), the Orsay museum, the Seine river banks, the French National Assembly, Notre-Dame, Paris City Hall, Ile Saint-Louis and Ile de la Cite, the Sainte-Chapelle, the Luxembourg Gardens, the Pantheon, Saint-Sulpice church, Madeleine church, luxury fashion stores (Bon Marché, Bd Saint-Germain, Rue Saint Honorée), The Élysée Palace (official residence of the President of the French Republic, François Hollande), frenchy pastry shops (Ladurée, Hermé, Bertillon) and an infinite choice of restaurants…some from Michelin stars (L'atelier Joel Robuchon, Helene Darroze, Le "Restaurant").  But still ... For night owls, trendy and legendary bar-clubs such as Montana, Chez Castel, Les Saints-Pères, The Pescription, Le tiger, Le Germain or T

host_about:
Bonjour,
Je m'appelle Alice et je vis à Paris depuis près de 10 ans.
J'ai la chance de vivre dans le plus beau quartier de Paris :)
J'aime voyager, en particulier aux Etats-Unis et la ville dans laquelle je reve de vivre est New York City :) 
J'ai voyagé en Asie, aux Etats-Unis, et en Europe.
Je suis très heureuse de travailler dans la gastronomie haut de gamme et les vins, au centre de Paris.

---

Hello ! 
I'm Alice and I live in Paris for almost 10 years.
I have the chance to live in the best part of Paris :)
I love travelling, especially in USA and the city I would like to live in is New York City :) I travelled In Asia, USA, Europe.
I am happy to work in the fine dining and wines in the heart of Paris.

neighborhood_overview: Notre quartier est dynamique et vivant avec de nombreux commerces, bars, restaurants, un quartier chinois à deux pas de la maison. Monoprix se situe en face de l'appartement, nous avons un grand marché juste en bas de l'immeuble le jeudi & le dimanche, une boulangerie, épicerie, boucherie, fleuriste,  pharmacie, poste, banque et de nombreuses boutiques le long de l'avenue.   Mais notre quartier est aussi très reposant et paisible avec des squares pour enfants et des superbes jardins (Luxembourg, Mont-souris, celui des plantes et la butte aux cailles pas loin).
transit: Très bien desservi :  - Métro ligne 7 Tolbiac à 2 minutes.  - Métro 5 et 6 Place D'Italie à 5 minutes.  - Métro 14 Olympiades à 5 minutes.  - Tram T3 Porte D'Italie à 5 minutes.  - Bus 62 et 47 à 1 minute.   Possibilité de garer son véhicule en bas de l'immeuble, gratuit de 20h à 8h.  Pour rejoindre le logement depuis l'aéroport, il suffit de prendre l'OrlyBus jusqu'au métro Denfert-Rochereaux (durée du trajet : entre 20 et 30 min) ou bien en taxi (15 min). Il y a également 3 gares à coté de l'appartement : Gare de Lyon, Gare Montparnasse & Gare Austerlitz.

name: Appartement calme près du Canal
summary: Notre appartement est clame et lumineux, il donne sur une cour arborée. Il se situe dans le quartier animé du 10eme arrondissement de Paris, à deux pas du canal Saint Martin et du plus grand espace vert parisien : les Buttes Chaumont.
space: Il y a une grande pièce principale avec cuisine intégrée, une salle de bain , une chambre ouverte sur le salon et un grand dressing. Idéal pour découvrir l'été parisien : des balades sur le canal, des pique niques aux Buttes Chaumont ou les soirées branchées au Rosa Bonheur.  x Un quartier populaire et branché. Des nombreux bars et restaurants proposant une grand variété gastronomique, ambiance décontractée et parisienne garantie.  A 10 min. à pied des cinémas MK2 Quai de Seine et Quai de Loire au bord du Canal de l'Ourcq (connexion en bateau à faire).  Un marché très agréable et varié a lieu tous les samedi matins devant l'immeuble.  A ne pas manquer : aller prendre un verre à l'incontournable café Chez Prune ou encore au célèbre Hôtel du Nord, tous les deux au bord du Canal Saint Martin.  Et bien d'autres adresses sont à découvrir que nous partagerons avec vous avec plaisir.  A 50 m. de la station métro Colonel Fabien (Ligne 2 Nation - Pere Lachaise - Montmartre - Champs Elysées) Con

name: Very close to the Eiffel Tower!
summary: Appartement très proche de la Tour Eiffel, lumineux et meublé avec goût. Il dispose d'une chambre avec lit double, d'une deuxième chambre avec un lit simple (un deuxième possible), d'une salle de bain avec baignoire et d'une salle de douche ainsi qu'un toilet séparé. Le côté chambre est sur cour très calme.  Appartment very close to the Eiffel Tower, bright and furnished with care. There is a bedroom with a double bed, a second bedroom with a single bed (a second bed is available).
space: The appartement si near to the Champs de Mars, the Saint Dominique street with is typical restaurants. You can take the bus boat and the "bateau-mouche" (the stations are located on the left bank to the Seine, close to the Eiffel Tower) wich will offer you a tour of Paris or will drive you to the Trocadero. Taxi ans bus stations are also available close to the building.
description: The appartement si near to the Champs de Mars, the Saint Dominique street with is typical restaurants. You can take the bus boat and the "bateau-mouche" (the stations are located on the left bank to the Seine, close to the Eiffel Tower) wich will offer you a tour of Paris or will drive you to the Trocadero. Taxi ans bus stations are also available close to the building. You have access to a very spacious living room. The kitchen, the bathroom ans the shower room are fully equiped. I can also ask someone to clean the apartement as often as you wish (with supplementary fees). You can contact me whenever you need if you have any questions. You will be near of each monuments and in the heart of real Paris. Going to walk along the Seine is really nice, especially during the summer and you can do it just going down to the building. A paying public parking is located ta École Militaire (7 minutes by foot). Taxi, bus, velib or autolib stations are located in the close vicinity of the building.

host_about: Je suis parisienne et je travaille à Paris. J'aime les voyages et je trouve que pouvoir partir en voyages en conservant le confort d'un appartement spacieux avec tout le nécessaire est une expérience très agréable pour l'apprécier d'autant plus. Par ailleurs, j'ai deux enfants et je sais que dans ce cas, c'est vraiment nécessaire!
street: Tour Eiffel - Champ de Mars, Paris, Île-de-France 75007, France

name: Chic apartment St Honoré /Tuileries
space: Beautiful one bedroom wooden floor apartment in the heart of Paris. Ideally located between Le Louvre, the Opera, and the upscale fashion stores of rue St Honoré ( Colette, Tom Ford, Angelina, Chanel...) First floor of a classical and chic building with an elevator, a digicode and interphone for your safety.    Large living room with chimney, a comfortable sofa with a very nice white carpet (Beni ouarain) and a dining table with 4 executive chairs (Charles Pollock)  HQ equipment (Plasma screen, Wifi connection and Bose sound system for IPod / iPhone) complete this lovely living room. The kitchen is perfectly equiped with a micro-wave, a baking oven, a washing/drying machine, a Magimix blender, a kettle and an eggs cooker.       The elegant bedroom will be perfect for quiet nights or relaxing naps with its dark blue walls and white doors ( wardrobe). It opens on a black and white bathroom with a comfortable bathtub. Five minutes walk from Opera, department stores (Galeries Lafayette...)

name: Superbe appartement - Notre Dame
summary: Appartement spacieux & lumineux, au cœur du Paris historique avec vue sur Nt Dame. Excellente situation.  Spacious & bright appartment in the heart of historical Paris with view on Notre Dame. Exceptional location.
space: Cet appartement est idéal pour une famille, sa localisation vous permettra de découvrir Paris dans ce que la ville a de plus authentique.  Il se compose de deux chambre, une familiale avec lit double et une chambre d'enfants avec lits superposés. Également dans le Salon, un canapé-lit une place. Cet appartement et son environnement vous garantissent un séjour plus qu'agréable et surtout très confortable. L'appartement a une surface de 60m2 et est entièrement à votre disposition.  Il se compose: - d'un grand salon en angle très lumineux avec cheminée, canapé, fauteuils, trois grandes fenêtres et un balcon filant offrant une vue imprenable sur Notre Dame. Paris sous vos fenêtres. - une cuisine ouverte avec un bar à l'américaine et entièrement équipée, réfrigérateur, congélateur, four électrique, micro-ondes, grille-pain, cafetière... - une chambre parentale avec un lit double et une chambre pour enfants avec des lits superposés (un canapé convertible dans le salon peut faire office de li
