Spacious & bright appartment in the heart of historical Paris with view on Notre Dame. Exceptional location. Cet appartement est idéal pour une famille, sa localisation vous permettra de découvrir Paris dans ce que la ville a de plus authentique.  Il se compose de deux chambre, une familiale avec lit double et une chambre d'enfants avec lits superposés. Également dans le Salon, un canapé-lit une place. Cet appartement et son environnement vous garantissent un séjour plus qu'agréable et surtout très confortable. L'appartement a une surface de 60m2 et est entièrement à votre disposition.  Il se compose: - d'un grand salon en angle très lumineux avec cheminée, canapé, fauteuils, trois grandes fenêtres et un balcon filant offrant une vue imprenable sur Notre Dame. Paris sous vos fenêtres. - une cuisine ouverte avec un bar à l'américaine et entièrement équipée, réfrigérateur, congélateu
neighborhood_overview: En plus de sa proximité avec tous ces lieux historiques, l'emplacement est idéal et vous permettra de faire l'expérience de l'authentique style de vie parisien. Au pied de l'immeuble, un grand nombre de restaurants, boulangeries, pâtisseries, boucheries, poissonnerie, primeurs, cavistes, supermarchés, librairies, la Piscine Pontoise... Enfin, Place Maubert se tient trois fois par semaine un Marché. Aside from being close to all the famous place, the appartment is located on a very authentic neightbourhood allowing you to live the genuine parisian way of life. In front of the building you'll find various restaurants and traditional shops (bakery, meat, fish, cheese shop, wine cellars...), supermarkets and boutiques, and also the swiming pool Pontoise & the famous Place Maubert, where there is three times a week an open-air market.
notes: Nous sommes une famille avec deux jeunes enfants et nous avons toujours vécu à Paris. Nous aimerions que notre appartement soit loué pendant notre absence l'été car c'est un appartement magnifique et vraiment très agréable à vivre... Nous espérons que vous l'apprécierez autant que nous! We are a young family with two small children, and we have always been living in Paris.  We would like to rent this aparment when we are away, because it is a wonderfull apartment and it is worth to use it.  We hope you will enjoy our apartment and the neighbourghood as much as we do. There is a lot of thing to enjoy here!
transit: Vous trouverez de nombreux moyens de transport à quelques pas de l'immeuble. Le RER B (pour rejoindre les aéroports de Roissy Charles de Gaulle ou Orly), le RER C (vers le Château de Versailles). Également le métro lignes 10, 4, 7, les Bus 24 (Gare Saint-Lazare, Madeleine, Concorde, Musée d'Orsay, Gare de Lyon, Gare de Bercy), 47 (Châtelet, Hôtel de ville), 86 (Saint-Germain-des-Prés, Saint-Sulpice, Île Saint-Louis, Place de la Bastille, Opéra Bastille, Parc zoologique), 87 (Tour Eiffel, Saint-Sulpice, Saint-Germain-des-Prés, Théâtre de l'Odéon, Île Saint-Louis, Opéra Bastille, Place de la Bastille, Gare de Lyon). A 100 m de l'immeuble, une borne Autolib et une borne Vélib pour découvrir Paris différemment! Sans oublier les célèbres Bateaux-bus qui partent des quais au niveau de Notre Dame. You will also find many and various means of transport, wether the RER B (deserving (Orly & Charles de Gaule airport) and C (going to Versailles), the Metro (line 4 and 10), the Bus 24 (Gare Saint-L
access: Vous serez logés dans l'un des plus beaux quartiers de Paris, en plein centre et dans le cœur historique, à deux pas de Notre Dame et du Panthéon, la Sorbonne, Rue Mouffetard, quartier Saint-Michel. Le Charme et le romantisme de l'Ile Saint Louis et le calme des Jardins du Luxembourg sont également à 5 min de marche. Vous pourrez profiter des nuits animées du Quartier Latin et de la rue Mouffetard. Tout est à moins de 5 min de marche. You'll be staying in one of the most charming neighbourhoods of Paris, and the most central area, at two steps from the famous Notre Dame and the Pantheon, Saint-Michel and la Sorbonne, the charm and the romantism of l'ile Saint Louis or the quietness of the Luxembourg Gardens, you can enjoy the nightlife of Quartier Latin and the Mouffetard street... Everything is at less than 5 minutes walking !
interaction: Nous laisserons à votre disposition les meilleures adresses, des informations précises sur toutes les activités possibles, tout ce qu'il y a à faire et à voir dans le coin (théâtres, cinémas, bonnes adresses, musées, galeries d'art etc.) We will provide you extensive information documents about things to see and to do in the area.
house_rules: Nous ferons de notre mieux pour rendre votre séjour le plus agréable possible. En échange nous vous demandons de respecter cet appartement comme s'il s'agissait de votre propre maison... Cet appartement est non-fumeur mais vous pouvez bien entendu fumer sur le balcon! Les animaux domestiques ne sont pas acceptés. Les accidents peuvent arriver, nous vous demandons juste de nous en informer afin de pouvoir remplacer ou réparer ce qui aurait pu être brisé. Nous laissons à disposition du café, du thé, faites-en de même si possible en repartant...Vous aurez des voisins, merci de respecter leur tranquillité! Entrée/Sortie Merci de nous tenir informés de l'heure approximative de votre arrivée sur place pour que nous organisions au mieux le Check-in.  Nous avons prévu un Check-in/Check-out à 9h ou 20h mais nous pouvons trouver une solution plus flexible selon votre heure d'arrivée. We will do our best to make your stay as pleasant as possible, in return we expect you to respect this appartment

name: Rare house with its courtyard near St Martin canal
summary: Our house is near the Canal St Martin and the Marais. You're in the center of the trendy and artsy Paris. You'll like the neighborhood for its authenticity and its cosmopolitanism with its traditional market place, its small cafés. It's within walking distance from Craft, Holybelly, the famous pains from "Des idees bakery" and lots of delicious bistros. You'll enjoy our house for being quiet and luminous. You'll also like its private courtyard and to watch the sky through the glass roof.
space: It is our home with our belongings and art objects that we rent while we are abroad. We have decorated ourselves and tried to make it as cosy as possible. We hope you'll feel at home too. Anyway it's a real place, inhabited, not aseptic like a hotel room. It's about 1400 square feet, with one master bedroom and two children rooms. One of the child room is on a mezzanine over looking a part of the second child room. The two sleeping areas are  There's two bathrooms, one with a sink and Italian shower in the master bedroom and one independent with a bathtub. The kitchen is fully equipped.

neighborhood_overview: We are big fans of our neighborhood !! We love the village feeling it has and it is still very authentic with a large diversity of people, businesses... There is still very near by a typical Parisian market to get your food. It is also close to almost everywhere in Paris by public transport. You are within 5 minutes walk from 6 different subway lines, numerous bus lines and within 10 minutes walk from le Canal St Martin, le Marais, Montorgueil, le Sentier, le Centre Pompidou, le boulevard Beaumarchais, the shop Merci and the BHV...
notes: We trust the people we accommodate and hope they will take good care our home.  No smoking inside and no unauthorized parties or extra guests.  Leave it the same as it was when you checked in. Anyone inside the unit must be on the reservation regardless if they are staying the night.  Do not touch the artwork Late check out is not permitted.  Fine is half the amount of stay. Lost keys 10
transit: You are 5 minutes walk away from 3 different subway stations, serving 5 different lines.
access: You will have access to the full apartment beside our mezzanine office and certain closets.
interaction: We are keen travelers so we are very aware of the pleasure of having insights from local inhabitants when we arrive somewhere. We also come from Parisians family and we love our city so it will be our pleasure to help you with organizing your stay. We have also prepared a small city guide with our favorites restaurants, bakeries, galleries....
house_rules: This is our home, we trust our tenants to be respectful of the place. Cette notre maison, nous faisons confiance à nos locataires pour respecter le lieu.
host_about: Filmmaker, I love travelling and meeting new people. I've met people around the world with a amazing sense of hospitality and I feel it is a very precious quality.

Iron Entire Flat I have lived in this area for years and can help you find all the good places to go. I speak english and will always try to be there
neighborhood_overview: THE NEIGHBORHOOD : The neighborhood has everything you need. There are shops specialized in wine, organic food... and great fresh food markets. Local restaurants Wine bars, Cafés Concert venues, Theatres... BY FOOT : 1 minute walk to the nearest shop. 1 minute walk to the nearest nice restaurant or wine bar. 3 minutes walk to the famous "Cimetière du Père Lachaise where Jim Morrison's grave is. 2 minutes walk to the biggest médiateque in France. 4 minutes walk to the botanic gardens. 2 minutes walk to the famous "La Flèche d'Or" for live music and performance. 2 minutes walk to "Mama Shelter", restaurant designed by Phillipe Stark. 5 minutes walk to the french and english library. 5 minutes walk to the nearest cinema.
notes: I am born in Paris, and I still love it so much. In paris everything is possible. There is always something to do, and new people to meet. A few metro stations away you find a new ambiance and a different population. You feel like traveling every day. I decided to live in this area because this is the real Paris for me, a melting pot with all kinds of populations, lots of artists and openminded people. The area is like a village and you're not anonymous, like often in big cites. I love this place because it is one of the more artistic in Paris, and you have a lot of nice restaurants, and good quality shops. I go to the big open grocery market every week, and I speak with my neighboors when I meet them. Even if you stay at home doing nothing, you know that it is all there waiting for you a few stations away. Now I decided to give you the opportunity to live the real Paris experience. Welcome !
transit: BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT : 10 minutes to the famous "Parc des Buttes Chaumont". 15 minutes to Bastille and Le Marais (historic center). 20 minutes to Montmartre, Pigalle and the Moulin Rouge. 25 minutes to the Louvre and Notre Dame. 30 minutes to the Arc de triumph and the Champs Elysées. TRANSPORT : Metro : Line 2. takes you to : Nation, Belleville, Pigalle, Montmartre, Moulin rouge. Bus 76 : takes you to : Place de la Bastille, Le Marais, Châtelet, Musée du Louvre. Bus 26 . takes you to : Jourdain, Parc des Buttes Chaumont, gare du Nord, gare Saint-Lazarre.
access: Entire Flat
interaction: I have lived in this area for years and can help you find all the good places to go. I speak english and will always try to be there to welcome you in person. Hope to see you soon !
house_rules: In this place the neighbors like it quiet, so I would like you to respect that. That means no partying in the apartment. For the respect of the environment, please don't heat with open windows. and leave the heaters on minimum when you're away. If you smoke, do it outside, for respect for the next host. And most important : enjoy your stay !

name: APPARTMENT IN THE CENTER-PARIS
summary: The apartment is a new renovated apartment 2 years ago, is located in the center of Paris near the Canal st martin and Republique. In the area there is a lot of life going on, bars and little cute restaurants.
space: Is a loft apartment with a mezzanine and a bathroom separate. The apartment have two big beds. One is mine, and the other one is for two people.
description: The apartment is a new renovated apartment 2 years ago, is located in the center of Paris near the Canal st martin and Republique. In the area there is a lot of life going on, bars and little cute restaurants. Is a loft apartment with a mezzanine and a bathroom separate. The apartment have two big beds. One is mine, and the other one is for two people. The accès is so easy to the apartment. The neighborhood is very young, ver "bobo" bohemian bourgeois in french. Young people, artists, mix of cultures living on the same area. Is very nice to explore it. The apartment is located in a really quiet building. The metro is located less than 5 minutes from the house. The most close is the line 11, goncourt, then at the same distance you have Belleville, and 7 mins walk Republique with the lines 5,3,9,11. There is also a lot of buses in the avenue parmentier situated really close to the house.

name: Montmartre house with terrace
space: Fantastic converted factory (totally renovated in 2001) suitable for those who love open living space. On three levels, comprising a secluded and very quiet South facing roof terrasse opening jointly on a bedroom with en-suite bathroom in distressed concrete with italian shower, and an open office or guest bedroom. On the main level is a perfectly harmonised salon, separate kitchen with ample room for entertaining and guest bathroom. On third, basement level, a laundry and storage space including a wine cellar. Housekeeper, bedlinen and towels included (4 hours a week). Parking space available.

space: THE APARTMENT: ROOMY, CONFY, PEACEFUL AND SUNNY Lovely apartment, ideally located in the very center of Paris (République / Canal Saint-Martin) for a quiet romantic or family stay, with plenty of activities at a walking distance! We offer you this charming 62 sqm apartment, running through two green courtyards, comprising a large living room, a bright dining-room, a comfortable bedroom (the three of them are south-oriented), a fully-equipped kitchen and a nice bathroom with a bathtub. Typically Parisian atmosphere : wooden floor, moldings and marble fireplace. Original decoration and tasteful furniture. Our delightful apartment can host 3 people. Ideal for a couple. The bedroom, particularly quiet, has a new and extremely comfortable queen-size bed, and plenty of storage. The large sofa in the living-room (or a very thick inflatable mattress if you prefer) can accommodate a third person. We provide warm duvets, clean sheets and clean large towels. neighborhood_overview: THE AREA: CENTRAL PARIS, LIVELY & ARTSY NEIGHBORHOOD In this unique frame, you can enjoy the relaxed lifestyle of the trendy neighborhood of the Canal Saint-Martin, its bustling canal sides, the Parisian bistros, the friendly wine bars, the young designers' boutiques and the numerous galleries. Very close to the Marais, the apartment is also conveniently located for your excursions in Paris, its historic center and its museums (3 metro stops from the Centre Pompidou). Many shops are nearby and open on Sundays and evenings up to 22:00: 3 supermarkets, grocery stores, bakeries, butchers, etc.. and small market on Sundays.

transit: The closest Metro stations are: République and Goncourt (Métro lines 3, 5, 8, 9, 11). Several bus lines and Vélib' stations are also easily accessible.

The  apartment keeps a pleasant temperature throughout the year, even in summer the flat is fresh , convenient to resist the heat of summer . The area is very nice with lots of shops and cool restaurants / bars. The decoration is neat, with designer furniture and vintage items, white floor. Passionnée par les voyages, j'ai pris l'habitude avec quelques amis de passer le nouvel an dans des capitales européennes ! Ce qui nous permet de rencontrer des nouvelles personnes, et de découvrir de nouvelles choses!
J'aime bien lire, regarder des films, avoir des discussions sérieuses ou moins sur des sujets assez variés. Je suis très ouverte et j'apprécie de rencontrer des nouvelles personnes.
J'aime voyager avec mon sac à dos et aller à la rencontre des personnes dans leur pays; c'est par la rencontre et les échanges que l'on découvre un pays ;-).

interaction: Directement avec les propriétaires
house_rules: Un bébé de 6 mois vit dans cet appartement, merci de ne pas fumer à l'intérieur. Vous pouvez profiter du balcon.
street: Porte de Clignancourt, Paris, Île-de-France 75018, France
